categories: Category:Solo: A Star Wars Story actors

nodes.text: Phoebe Mary Waller-Bridge (born July 14, 1985) is an English actress, writer, playwright, and director who portrays L3-37 in Solo: A Star Wars Story.

Waller-Bridge won the 2017 BAFTA TV Award for Best Female Performance in a Comedy, for her role in Fleabag, a television series which she developed, wrote and starred in, based upon her stage play of the same name. In 2019, she won three Emmy awards for the show's second and final season, winning for Outstanding Writing In A Comedy Series, Outstanding Lead Actress In A Comedy Series, and Outstanding Comedy Series.

Waller-Bridge was also the showrunner, head writer, and executive producer of the first season of Killing Eve, a BBC America television series based upon the Codename Villanelle novellas of Luke Jennings.

She will co-star alongside Daniel Craig in the upcoming James Bond film No Time to Die (set for release October 8, 2021) and alongside Harrison Ford in the upcoming fifth Indiana Jones film (scheduled for release on July 29, 2022).
